column5: We're heading to a new lake this year. We've been going to Shining Falls the last 5 years with great success. We had numerous fishing spots for every kind of weather, however, some of the guys in our group wanted more adventure so we're going to Carroll lake in early September. Basically I was hoping some one out there has fished this lake before and wouldn't mind sharing some good starting points and/or might be able to help with some basic patterns for finding schools of Walleye and Big Pike. Also, was wondering which is better, minnow or worm on a jig? Thanks for any help, Jeff (Rookie)
